definition: to go out/to go away (on a trip etc)
outside/in addition/foreign/external

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
to make an official visit (often abroad)
to forbid sb to go out/to curfew/to ground (as disciplinary measure)

sentences.english: It said people should cover their mouths when outside and keep doors and windows closed.
sentences.chinese: 还说人们外出时应该遮好嘴巴并且关好门窗。

sentences.english: She thinks I'm going out with Jeremy but she's completely on the wrong tack .
sentences.chinese: 她认为我准备同杰里米外出，但是她的想法完全错了。

sentences.english: Meteorologists advised the public to wear face masks to ward off dust.
sentences.chinese: 气象学家建议公众外出时戴口罩。

sentences.english: He charged me to take good care of his children while he was away.
sentences.chinese: 他外出时托付我好生照顾他的孩子。

sentences.english: She goes out in all weathers.
sentences.chinese: 无论天气如何，她都要外出。

sentences.english: If you get out more you can meet more new friends.
sentences.chinese: 如果你更加经常外出，你就会结交到更多的朋友。

sentences.english: Although people going to follow, but also try to find a telephone.
sentences.chinese: 外出时虽有人跟随，但也要想办法找电话打。

sentences.english: I work out on a daily basis and I play racquetball in between.
sentences.chinese: 我每天按部就班地外出工作，并在闲暇时玩壁球。

sentences.english: What do you spend on going out with coworkers?
sentences.chinese: 和同事一起外出要花多少钱？

sentences.english: The travelling accounts are handled by me.
sentences.chinese: 这次的外出旅游账目由我负责管理。

sentences.english: In December, we must wear heavy clothes when go out since it is clod at that time.
sentences.chinese: 十二月天寒地冻，所以我们穿上厚重的衣服外出。

sentences.english: You can easily fake up an excuse to avoid going out with him.
sentences.chinese: 为避免同他一起外出，你可以很容易地编造一个借口。

sentences.english: A few of them were going out later that night for drinks.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，几个人喝完酒后就外出找乐子了。

sentences.english: Moren Jie phone means that people on the one.
sentences.chinese: 没人接电话意味着一家人都外出了。

sentences.english: Police believe the family was targeted when the father was at work.
sentences.chinese: 警察相信是当父亲外出工作时，他们被蓄意谋杀的。

sentences.english: Whether we'll go out the weather.
sentences.chinese: 我们是否外出得看天气而定。

definition: to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
outer/excluded
to go on a tour/to have an outing
alone
to take along with one
to go onto the streets/to go shopping
to go out somewhere (relatively short trip)/to set off on a journey (longer trip)
to go out
cold weather
to leave early and return late (idiom)
to go on an official or business trip
to walk around/to move about/to stretch one's legs/to go for a walk/to be mobile (e.g. after an illness)/to visit one another/to pay a visit (go to the toilet)
to fall ill
to go to work/to be on duty/to start work/to go to the office
to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
to return home
